intro: Sitodium cauliflorum, commonly known as the clustered sedge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its compact, clustered growth habit and its ability to thrive in wet or moist environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing at the base of the plant, which is a distinctive feature. Sitodium cauliflorum is often found in marshy areas and is adapted to tolerate waterlogged soils.
